evidence.text:
Person A: You don't care if your father is an important person?
Person B: No
Person A: Seriously?
Person B: What does my father's job have to do with me?
Person A: I mean, wouldn't you care if Dad was selling cigarettes in the streets right now?

Person A: What do you mean? No way! I don't like it to be loose like this.
Person B: Please fix the front as well. Thank you.
Person B: When will it be ready?
Person B: Mom, I told you. Now, why are you so strict about Sadaf all of a sudden? … Okay.
Person A: What are you doing Sadaf?

Person B: What are you saying? Do you have to do everything that I do?
Person B: It is not possible to stay home all the time.
Person B: I don’t know. Why do we argue with her when we know she doesn’t accept anything?

Person A: The only way is to tell Mom to help us.
Person B: Mom? what do you want to say?
Person A: We have to tell the truth, there is no other way.
Person A: Mom, why do you think we took it? Do you think it’s okay if I do the same to you and blame you for it?

Person A: What if Dad is lying, did you see him bring the gun home with your own eyes?
Person A: There was no weapon, Dad is so busy he got confused. He gave away his gun somewhere else and prefers to say that someone took it at home.
Person B: Here, wear a mask. While he was filling in the gas, a guy took photos and videos of him and the car.

Person A: what is Dad doing?
Person B: He still has a gun!
Person A: Has he gone crazy? let's take the phone and call Uncle Asad!

Person A: Sana?
Person B: Yes, my dear?
Person B: Dad, can we see your family album on this trip?
